destinations.name: Maasai Mara
destinations.description: Experience the world-famous Maasai Mara, home to Africa’s Big Five and the breathtaking Great Migration. Witness millions of wildebeest and zebras crossing the Mara River in an unforgettable wildlife spectacle.

destinations.name: Victoria Falls
destinations.description: Known as 'The Smoke That Thunders,' Victoria Falls is one of the largest and most awe-inspiring waterfalls in the world. Feel the power of nature as millions of liters of water plunge into the Zambezi River.

destinations.name: Serengeti National Park
destinations.description: Explore the vast plains of the Serengeti, where thousands of animals roam freely. Witness the stunning wildlife, including lions, elephants, cheetahs, and giraffes, in their natural habitat.

destinations.name: Table Mountain
destinations.description: A must-visit landmark in Cape Town, Table Mountain offers panoramic views of the city and ocean. Whether hiking to the top or taking the cableway, the experience is unforgettable.

destinations.name: Pyramids of Giza
destinations.description: Step back in time and explore the legendary Pyramids of Giza. These ancient wonders of the world have stood for over 4,500 years, offering a glimpse into Egypt’s fascinating history and culture.

destinations.name: Bwindi Impenetrable Forest
destinations.description: Home to the endangered mountain gorillas, Bwindi Impenetrable Forest is a haven for wildlife enthusiasts. Trek through the dense forest to encounter these majestic creatures in their natural habitat.

destinations.name: Kruger National Park
destinations.description: Embark on a safari adventure in Kruger National Park, one of Africa’s largest game reserves. Spot the Big Five and other wildlife species as you explore the diverse landscapes of this iconic park.

destinations.name: Okavango Delta
destinations.description: Discover the unique ecosystem of the Okavango Delta, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Experience mokoro rides, game drives, and walking safaris in this pristine wilderness teeming with wildlife.

destinations.name: Zuma Rock
destinations.description: Zuma Rock, known as the 'Gateway to Abuja,' is a massive monolith rising 725 meters above the plains. It holds cultural significance and is a must-visit landmark in Nigeria.

destinations.name: Cape Coast Castle
destinations.description: A historic fortress along Ghana's coast, Cape Coast Castle was a key site during the transatlantic slave trade. Explore its dark dungeons and breathtaking ocean views.

destinations.name: Dakar Pink Lake (Lac Rose)
destinations.description: Lac Rose is a stunning pink-hued lake near Dakar, known for its high salt content and surreal beauty. Visitors can float effortlessly in its waters, similar to the Dead Sea.

destinations.name: Grand-Bassam Beach
destinations.description: A UNESCO-listed historic town with colonial charm and stunning beaches. Relax on the golden sands or explore its vibrant local markets.

destinations.name: Bijagós Archipelago
destinations.description: A hidden paradise of over 80 islands, rich in biodiversity and home to rare species like saltwater hippos. A true escape into untouched nature.

destinations.name: Matmata Cave Dwellings
destinations.description: Visit the famous underground homes of Matmata, known for their appearance in Star Wars. Experience unique Berber culture in these ancient dwellings.

destinations.name: The Blue City of Chefchaouen
destinations.description: Wander through the enchanting blue-painted streets of Chefchaouen, a city nestled in the Rif Mountains of Morocco.

destinations.name: Roman Ruins of Leptis Magna
destinations.description: Explore the remarkably preserved ruins of Leptis Magna, a once-thriving Roman city along the Mediterranean coast of Libya.

destinations.name: Virunga National Park
destinations.description: Home to the endangered mountain gorillas, Virunga National Park is one of Africa’s oldest and most biodiverse parks, offering breathtaking volcanic landscapes and incredible wildlife experiences.

destinations.name: Dzanga-Sangha Reserve
destinations.description: Explore the lush rainforests of Dzanga-Sangha, known for its large populations of forest elephants, lowland gorillas, and unique Ba’aka pygmy culture.

destinations.name: Loango National Park
destinations.description: Loango National Park offers a rare blend of savannah, rainforest, and coastline, where you can witness elephants and hippos roaming on pristine beaches.

destinations.name: São Tomé and Príncipe Islands
destinations.description: A paradise of volcanic islands with lush rainforests, São Tomé and Príncipe is perfect for ecotourism, birdwatching, and breathtaking ocean views.

destinations.name: Kahuzi-Biega National Park
destinations.description: One of the last refuges of the eastern lowland gorillas, Kahuzi-Biega National Park offers unforgettable encounters with these gentle giants in their natural habitat.

agencies.name: Island Getaways, São Tomé
agencies.location: São Tomé, São Tomé and Príncipe
